annual crop land: Presence of farming equipment or tire tracks
Green or brown fields (depending on the crop and season)
forest: lack of man-made structures like irrigation systems or orderly planting rows
Forested areas may have trails or paths but are generally dense and less open compared to pasture lands
brushland or shrubland: Native or wild vegetation not organized in rows
Variety of plant species including bushes and brambles
Sparse trees or none at all
highway or road: absence of large structures or buildings
industrial buildings or commercial build: Buildings with straight lines and structured shapes
pasture land: Absence of large machinery tracks typically associated with row crops
Natural features like trees, shrubs, or ponds
farm-related structures (like barns or silos) if present
permanent crop land: Absence of roads, driveways, and parking areas
farming equipment like tractors or plows
residential buildings or homes or apartm: Personal vehicles like cars or bicycles parked outside
Rooftops with materials like shingles or tiles
river: Narrow width compared to lakes and seas
Vegetation like reeds or aquatic plants along the edges
lake or sea: Reflections of the sky or nearby objects
